alert.note: Alert for Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 7:26PM PDT until April 11 at 3:22AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oregon... Malheur River Near Vale affecting Malheur County. .Warm temperatures have caused the snowpack to melt and increase river flows. For the Malheur River...including Vale...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Malheur River Near Vale. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, The river will begin spilling over its bank flooding farmland between Vale and Ontario. Water will begin approaching low spots on Butte Drive. Water will approach the 36th Street Bridge upstream from Ontario about 8 hours after flood stage is exceeded near Vale. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Monday /6:30 PM PDT Monday/ the stage was 18.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.9 feet tonight. - Action stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM MDT /330 AM PDT/.
